[OTPHER]. /yr• FROM WASHDiGTON TO FOREIGN OFFICE . © Viscount Halifax, No» 2400c May1941. Do 6.00 p.m. May 29th, 1941. R 9 2.40 p.m. May 29th, 1941e At Foreign Office from the Ministry of Aircraft Production. \ yyyyyyy State Department informed us yesterday that Iraqi Minister for Foreign Affairs had transmitted to United States Minister at Bagdad a copy of a message from Sultan of Muscat to head of Muscat Mission in Bagdad instructing him to approach the United States Legation for travelling expenses to return to Muscat. United States Minister had replied that he would ask Washington for instructions, his recommendation to Washington was that the Mission should he assisted to proceed to Tehran en route for Muscat and that this would cost about 500 dollars which he could advance if so instructed. 2. State Department were tickled by Iraqi communication which incidentally was in very different tone from some recent impertinent messages. They thought peculiar procedure was probably due to physical inability of Muscat Mission to contact His Majesty's Embassy in Bagdad and reluctance of Tragi Ministry cf Foreign Affairs to hold any communication with the British. 5. It was agreed that Muscat Mission could probably remain in Bagdad for a v/hile without harm and if Mission proceeded to Tehran they would no doubt contact His Majesty's Legation there. Instruct me if you v/ish United States Minister to advance sum proposed for eventual recovery from His Majesty s eovernmento RECd. S*OL. dipt. -3JUN94! INDIA OFFICE

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 3; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located at the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a copy of a telegram sent to the Foreign Office by HM Ambassador to the United States, regarding a message sent by the Sultan of Muscat to the Head of the Muscat Mission in Bagdad [Baghdad] instructing him to approach the United States Legation for travelling expenses to return to Muscat.

name.namePart: Sultan of Muscat and Oman, Āl Bū Sa'īd Dynasty
HM Ambassador to the United States of America
